div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

div.div: Posted 6 months ago. Owned for 3 weeks when reviewed.

div.p: Best vacuum ever!!! I didn’t know that my dog was shedding. When I used the device that has the laser light, it lit up all the hair that fell off my dog. I cringed when I saw my floor like that and started vacuuming away. I vacuumed the furniture, table, kitchen cabinet, chairs, walls, you name it, I vacuumed it. Even my fake plants and flowers. My house feels clean. It’s worth the money. And I’m saving money too, because, I ditched my broom. swiffer duster, swiffer cloth that you use on the floor. To top it off, I don’t have to hire a cleaning lady, because, I was thinking of getting one. This vacuum does the job so fast. It saves time in doing the cleaning. All you have to do is charge it fully and if it runs out off charge, you can do something else around the house while you charge it again. I highly recommend this vacuum. My only regret is, “why didn’t I get it sooner!!!” I didn’t like the price of this vacuum, so, I bought cheaper vacuums and other paraphernalia. In the end, I spend more money. Take my advice, buy this vacuum, you won’t regret it. I hope they’ll not increase the price of this vacuum after my review, because, I intend to get another one.

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

div.h4: Must have for hard floors - Also LASERS!

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
I currently own a Dyson Big Ball Cinetic vacuum, and I've been interested in a cordless Dyson for some time. The Dyson V15 Cordless Vacuum is extremely powerful, and has more than enough suction for both hard surfaces and carpet.
If you are looking for a primarily hard floor vacuum, I can't recommend this vacuum highly enough. I would give it a 10 out of 5 stars if I could for the hard surface innovative technology they put into this vacuum, which I'll go into further later.
If you are looking primarily for a carpet vacuum, I would suggest going with an upright vs this cordless model. The cordless model definitely cleans carpet well and has incredible suction, but the bin fills quickly and is awkwardly difficult to push on carpet. Don't get me wrong, it absolutely will get the job done, and for my house that is 75% hard floors and 25% carpet, it may end up being my preferred vacuum overall if I'm only vacuuming a single room at a time, but I found myself emptying the bin several times cleaning a single room, so a larger canister would be preferred.
THE LASER The hard surface attachment, give the name "Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head" is an absolute game changer for hard surfaces. It's literally mind blowing, and the attached photos will showcase why. Areas where I wouldn't have thought to clean, such as behind a book case lit up when the green laser shined on the area, and I couldn't help but move the bookcase to clean up what is admittedly a disgusting amount of dust and hair that had accumulated.
Not only is it practical to have dust and hair highlighted by a laser when cleaning the floors, it also gives a sense of accomplishment when the job is complete and the laser no longer shows signs of any nasty things remaining to be cleaned. I feel better about the clean because there is physical evidence that something is different now vs before I cleaned. To be honest, it has made me more interested in cleaning more frequently as well because I can really tell when it's making a difference or not. Surprisingly, the central walkway areas are actually pretty clean already. The sides of the walkways and the walls are where the dust and hair accumulate. It makes sense, but I never would have realized it without this laser attachment.
I did find the laser works better in darker environments. I actually vacuumed my laundry room and bathroom without turning on a light, and it made it easier to see the dust that collected and was picked up.
The slim profile allowed me to clean underneath a cabinet we have in one of our bathrooms. Though I wouldn't go so far as to say it was "easy", I wouldn't have cleaned the space at all with my normal vacuum, so it definitely is a bonus of using the handheld.
The vacuum comes with a number of other attachments, one for cleaning pet hair, one smaller attachment for smaller spaces, and another brush I imagine might be used when vacuuming out a car. Overall though, I'm most likely going to keep the laser attachment on and likely use my upright vacuum for carpet.
Some minor negatives: Weight: Although it's a handheld vacuum, using it for extended periods of time or lifting it to try and vacuum awkward spaces isn't as carefree and easy as you might see in a commercial. I imagine my wife cleaning her entire car with this might be fairly taxing. It's not a dealbreaker, but it's something to be mindful of depending on the job you're looking the vacuum to do.
Canister size and design: The vacuum sports an "easy to use" release lever that pushes the junk out of the canister into the trash. Generally pushing this lever up and down several times will get rid of the dust and hair, but it's not a simple one push empty I imagined it would be. Additionally, the canister doesn't fill up evenly so even though the left half of the canister was mostly empty, the right side filled up and overflowed past the rubber stopper that separates the canister from the filter system. This creates a situation where when emptying the canister, I had to reach up inside and pull hair out of the rubber gasket, dirtying my hands and defeating the purpose of the quick release lever. The canister also filled up very quickly. I imagine that's partly due to our negligence in up keeping the room I had vacuumed (it had been a while), but having to empty the canister several times in a single room was not ideal. Lastly, in order to empty the canister, the hose has to be disconnected from the main canister, adding an additional step to an already less-than-perfect process.
I will say that the canister expulsion does work better than what is in my Dyson upright. It's not a bad design, but it could use some refining, and the rubber gasket should do a better job of keeping collected dust and hair out of the filtration chamber.
Battery: There is an on-screen display that provides an estimate of time remaining while using the vacuum that automatically adjusts based on usage. I found when switching from the hard flooring to carpet that the run time cut in half. On hard floor, It estimated ~40 minutes remaining shortly after a full charge. I switched to the carpet attachment when it was at ~36 minutes remaining, and the estimated time dropped in half to ~18 minutes. This was fortunately enough time for me to complete what I had set out to vacuum, but really necessitates a full charge between any prolonged use. The battery was "good enough" but I wouldn't say it excelled. I imagine to get the "up to 1 hour" of runtime, that may be perhaps with no moving attachment, such as when vacuuming a car.
MIXED Advanced whole-machine filtration: This is a bit of a mixed feature. Dyson claims the air expelled from the vacuum is cleaner than the air we normally breathe. I think that innovation is amazing, and I'm glad to know that the powerful gust of air shooting out of the vacuum isn't further spewing allergens into the air. That said, the placement of the "blower" that expels air made vacuuming my office space very awkward. It's positioned on the side of the vacuum, so vacuuming around my desk caused papers to fly off my desk onto the floor, which was double inconvenient because I had to stop vacuuming to pick them up before I could vacuum the spot they fell on. The Dyson is powerful, which means there is a ton of air expelled to create the awesome suction that it has. It was nearly comical when papers 6 feet away would get blown right off a desk, but after the 4th time stopping the vacuum to pickup papers, it became a bit frustrating.
The LCD screen: Displays a cumulation of the particles that it picked up so you can see whether there are more allergen particles vs skin flakes or dust mites. It's neat I guess, but I'm not sure that information is actually useful to me.
All that said, for hard floors, I absolutely love this vacuum and can't recommend it highly enough. I'll say it again -- LASERS. It really is a functional game changer for house cleanliness and not gimmicky at all.
If you have have primarily hard floors, buy this Dyson V15 Detect, and you will not be disappointed.

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

div.h4: Dyson Delivers in their Newest Cordless Addition

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
The Dyson V15 Detect is my second Dyson cordless style vacuum, first one was a hit and the V15 hits it out of the park. In a word, it is awesome. As always Dyson vacuums are stylish while delivering on exceptional cleaning and ease of use.
First impression, the vacuum’s Hyperdymium motor and cannister are noticeably larger than my earlier model while maintaining the same overall length, brilliant engineering and design. The power and performance are amazing in a cord free machine, believe that it hands down outperforms my corded vacuum. According to ASTM F558 (vacuum testing standard) testing of the Hyperdymium motor shows the V15 “delivers the most suction of any cordless vacuum.”
The V15 Detect is well balanced, comfortable, easy to handle, incredibly quiet, and checks all the ergonomic boxes.
Easy setup: unpack and attach the wand and battery to the vacuum, select an head attachment and you are set.
The charging/docking station requires only two screws to mount to a wall for storage, thoughtfully Dyson kept the mounting screws pattern the same as our previous model. Simply installed the new docking station with the same screws into the same holes, appreciate the attention to detail.
LCD Screen: 1. Displays selectable Eco, Auto, or Boost power levels - we use Auto as the machine will adjust power based on amount of debris and battery runtime 2. Battery charge runtime left in minutes and seconds 3. Maintenance notifications 4. Displays “scientific proof of a deep clean.” The particulate displays shows Allergens, Microscopic Dust, Dust Mites and Sugar readouts that were vacuumed - 36,475,810 Allergens were picked-up a one minute on one test I ran!
Runtime: 1. Medium mode - 45 minutes with Power Head attachment 2. Eco mode – 90 minutes 3. Full charge – four hours
Seven Accessories + 1. Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head - Laser Detect for Hardwood Floors Illuminates hidden dust on hard floors – cool feature 2. High Torque Drive cleaner head - Deep cleans rugs and carpets and designed to prevent hairs being tangled in the brush 3. Dyson Hair Tool – If you have an indoor pet this is an invaluable tool for removing pet hair from furniture and hard to get at spaces 4. Crevice Tool 5. Stubborn dirt brush 6. Soft dusting brush – great for dusting the complete house – Blinds have never been so clean 7. Combination tool 8. Wand Storage Clip – can attach two of the smaller head attachments to the wand – handy
Likes: 1. Converts to hand held 2. Filter traps 99.9 percent of allergen and dust particles – “Expels cleaner air than the air you breath” 3. Trigger locks when battery needs a charge 4. Bin is easy to clean, we eject the debris directly into our trash bags
We have many things in our life that needs cleaning and the Dyson V15 Detect simply answers the call, carpet, hard floor, rugs, blinds, air filters, fans, vehicles.... love to use it to clean the dust on desks, tables, pictures, crafts, bookshelves..... and makes quick work of it in their latest stroke of genius.
You may gather I like the machine, true but the proof is in the pudding, my wife loves the V15 and she is a tougher customer than I.

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

div.div: Posted 10 months ago. Owned for 1 month when reviewed.

div.p: I made a gift for my wife on New Years evening (in our country we make a gifts on New Years Evening, no Christmas). She is always keep our home in clean condition. If she doesn’t have a time or she doesn’t want to clean something in the house she asks me and I will clean it. Since we got this Dyson vacuum she never asked me to vacuum in the house, she always does it by herself. She keep telling me while she is vacuuming “I like to vacuum now, I am like meditating while I do this”. So if you like to see your wife smiling while she is vacuuming forget about the price, just buy it. If wife is happy everybody is happy.

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
If you DON'T want to know how dirty your floors are, don't get this. In a word . . . AMAZING! I would give it 6 or 7 stars out of 5 if I could.
To set the scene: Our house was built in the 30s and has hardwood floors throughout. We have 2 dogs (a Rottie and a Yorkie) and 2 cats (1 long-haired, 1 short) who allow us to live with them. They are constantly in and out. We have hardwood floors throughout the house with a couple area rugs.
PROS
~ Amazing suction ~ Laser ~ Cordless ~ Lightweight ~ Comes with tons of heads ~ Pivot on heads for angles ~ Changing attachments very simple ~Dumping cannister is easy and not messy ~ Trigger activation like on a weedeater
CONS
~ Possibly battery Life (I will put this under MEH, too because I don't know for sure, but I'll explain)
MEH (Could go either way)
~Possibly battery life
OVERALL
After receiving this, I charged it per the instructions and then vacuumed a small section of carpet my wife vacuumed the night before with our old (now thrown away) vacuum cleaner. I only vacuumed about 10 square feet and we were both amazed and disgusted by the amount of stuff this vacuum picked up. I think it must have reached all the dirt that filters through carpets and stays there until you sell the house. LOL. The cannister was almost full after 10-15 Sq Ft.
The head for hardwood floors has a laser (shown in a photo). It will show every imperfection in your floor and speck of dust. It's awesome. Yesterday, we vacuumed the entire house, including the sofa, drapes, etc. It had to be recharged a couple times. But the battery learns and extends time. It picks up or reduces speed based on the amount of grit/dirt. So, honestly, I expect it will actually last longer as the amount of ambient dust and grit is removed from my house.
Also pictured is what I gathered this morning just going over half the living room. That much additional dirt and hair fell in less than 24 hours.
The heads are on a ball/socket kind of system like a shoulder where they have incredible flexibility and maneuverability.
It actually isn't that loud. It has a high pitch, but I think it's a little quieter than the full-sized vacuum we just tossed out.
If you're looking for a compact vacuum for mostly hard floors and some rugs/carpets, I would highly recommend this one. It really is amazing. I vacuumed today just because it seemed fun to spot all the extra stuff. LOL. I couldn't be happier with this vacuum ... unless it learned how to fix me coffee in the morning.
I hope this helps you. I generally don't gush like this over things I review, but it really is a great piece of machinery. If it is in your price range or even slightly above, do yourself, your family and your floors a favor and pick it up.

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

div.h4: The Superpowers You Need to be Captain Tidy

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
Let's be clear, I love Dyson products. While other brands occasionally develop a competitive product, no one does design- aesthetic and performance with the consistency of Dyson. Add the innovation factor and they just keep themselves ahead. The V15 Detect is another example. Using a similar form factor to the prior V-series handheld cordless products, the V15 provides two key innovations: A green laser to help you see how dirty your place is (yikes!) and an LCD screen that "displays scientific proof of a deep clean" (also yikes!). The former is a forehead slapper. How did no one think of this before? I found it particularly helpful along baseboards and underneath furniture and cabinet edges. It assists you in feeling confident about getting a good clean floor. The latter is interesting and will likely help compel getting the kids to help clean. The LCD calculates and categorizes vacuumed particles, as well as displaying a constantly changing run-time and the power mode (Eco, Auto/Medium, Boost). If you’re a germaphobe, or dealing with allergies I suppose it will help you identify what may be troubling you. I just don’t know what’s “normal”. The whole machine filtration traps 99.99% of particles as small as 0.3 microns, expelling cleaner air than you breathe, according to Dyson.
Performance-wise. It’s as you would expect from Dyson. Amazing. The V-15 detects the conditions and throttles the motor suction and runtime accordingly when in Auto mode. Pretty cool. You’ll also see your projected runtime vary according to intensity of use. Supposedly, the device will learn over time. In my initial uses I’ve achieved over 30 minutes doing my entire 750 sf all hard surfaced apartment (including some soft furniture vacuum time).
The V-15 is packaged with a plethora of attachments: +The aforementioned “Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head” +“High torque cleaner head with anti-tangle comb” – This one automatically adjusts to flooring type and reduces hair tangling. I have to go with their word since I have really short hair. Seems like a plus though. +“Hair screw tool” intended for sofas, stairs and pet beds. +A very beautiful glossy-finished extension tube for the two former attachments, as well as the following more standard pieces: +Three brush/upholstery tools +Crevice tool.
Though a little hefty, it’s a well-balanced, fun, high-performing cleaning device. You’ll feel very accomplished when cleaning your home.

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
Pros -Very strong suction -Laser light dust detector -Long-lasting battery
Cons -Hand grip ergonomics -No trigger 'lock' -Small dustbin space
Dyson has just raised the bar for me when it comes to cordless stick vacuums. The single most important feature of any vacuum, is its suction power, because what's the point if it can't suck up the dirt, debris and hair. Dyson touts this as having the strongest motor of any cordless and it absolutely lives up to the claim.
My house has both hardwood floors and carpet. When on carpet, with the high torque cleaner head attached, it practically glues itself to the carpet with its suction power. It was even more evident by how much and how fast the dust bin was filling up. To put some perspective on it, I used to sell Kirby's long ago, for years nothing could match it in terms of power, until it got replaced by another brand's stick vacuum last year which I felt, at the time, had finally outperformed it. Then I got this Dyson V15 and it blew my mind with how much more it was pulling up out of the carpet. When my wife first used it, before knowing or seeing the results of my first use, came to me ecstatically after just a minute's use showing off the dustbin contents. The one downside to this is that the dustbin doesn't have a huge capacity and had to be emptied out constantly.
As for my hardwood floors, it did a great job too, but you don't exactly need the world's strongest suction power for hard flat surfaces. What really sets this Dyson apart is the fluffy cleaner head with laser. I'll admit, the laser light seemed a bit gimmicky to me at first. Once I started using it though, I instantly fell in love with it. For one, it always feels good to see the before and after when cleaning. Other than large 'tumblefurs' from my dogs, you couldn't really see the difference as much on the floors, other than what filled up in the bin. But now, no more going over spots multiple times trying to remember if you went over it already. No more wondering if the floors really need a vacuuming or not, since you can see it right away!
Then there's the hair tool attachment. This little thing works better than anything I've used before at getting hairs off of furniture. But even more than that, it works exceptionally well at vacuuming the upholstery inside my vehicles, especially the dog hair that gets attached to everything inside my truck. I'm sure the sheer power of the suction is a big part of that too though.
With all these attachments though, you'll need somewhere to store them. The bracket to hang the vacuum on can only hold so many.
Next on the list is the battery, because how strong the motor is doesn't really matter if you can't power it. I'm happy to report that so far, after a week's use, this battery lasts longer than other cordless vacs I've had. I just have a small 1544 s.f. house, but I can easily vacuum every inch of floor surface on one single charge. My previous cordless vac, even when brand new just a year ago, required a second battery to get the whole house done.
One of the reasons that the battery lasts longer is because of the automatic power adjustment based on the dirt level it senses. You'll mostly notice this on hard surfaces as it tends to be in 'eco' mode, but powers up fast when it detects a lot of hair/debris. Of course it allows you to choose your own mode if you want to keep it in eco or boost all the time.
The vac also has a small lcd screen that shows what mode you're in, the battery level, and the different sized particles of dirt/dust it's picked up. This last bit seemed a bit gimmicky to me as well, and while it's cool to see, it's not as useful as the laser head which shows you the dust itself.
Last thing I want to talk about is the ergonomics of this vacuum. Unfortunately, this is where the flaws show up. Weight wise it's not too heavy and lighter than my other stick vacuum so that's good. The handle though is the problem. After a bit of use, the weight of the motor being above my hand kept putting pressure on the knucklebone of my thumb, which after a while, started to get sore. It became much more noticeable after picking it back up later the same day. My wife also had an issue but it was with her trigger finger, but same type of cause. Even when you try to adjust your hand position, the weight of the motor being above just forces it down on your hand.
Speaking of the trigger, it is nice for the fact that you can easily release it and save some battery when you're not actively on the floor vacuuming. And it's very light so just maintaining a normal grip on the handle is enough to keep it pressed in. However, it would have been nice to have some sort of trigger 'lock' to keep it on. I actually had a use case this morning where I needed both hands to do something with the vacuum on, but couldn't because I had no way of actually keeping it on. I had to get my wife to help and hold the trigger in for me. It's a rare situation, but still one to be aware of.
Overall, this is by far the strongest cordless vac I've ever used that rivals the best corded ones. The few negatives are minor in comparison to all the positives and while this isn't a cheap vacuum, it lives up to the Dyson reputation and as the saying goes, you get what you pay for, and with this you get peace of mind that it's actually picking up all the dirt, dust, hair and debris from your floors and carpets.

Cons
-Hand grip ergonomics
-No trigger 'lock'
-Small dustbin space

Dyson has just raised the bar for me when it comes to cordless stick vacuums. The single most important feature of any vacuum, is its suction power, because what's the point if it can't suck up the dirt, debris and hair. Dyson touts this as having the strongest motor of any cordless and it absolutely lives up to the claim.

My house has both hardwood floors and carpet. When on carpet, with the high torque cleaner head attached, it practically glues itself to the carpet with its suction power. It was even more evident by how much and how fast the dust bin was filling up. To put some perspective on it, I used to sell Kirby's long ago, for years nothing could match it in terms of power, until it got replaced by another brand's stick vacuum last year which I felt, at the time, had finally outperformed it. Then I got this Dyson V15 and it blew my mind with how much more it was pulling up out of the carpet. When my wife first used it, before knowing or seeing the results of my first use, came to me ecstatically after just a minute's use showing off the dustbin contents. The one downside to this is that the dustbin doesn't have a huge capacity and had to be emptied out constantly.

As for my hardwood floors, it did a great job too, but you don't exactly need the world's strongest suction power for hard flat surfaces. What really sets this Dyson apart is the fluffy cleaner head with laser. I'll admit, the laser light seemed a bit gimmicky to me at first. Once I started using it though, I instantly fell in love with it. For one, it always feels good to see the before and after when cleaning. Other than large 'tumblefurs' from my dogs, you couldn't really see the difference as much on the floors, other than what filled up in the bin. But now, no more going over spots multiple times trying to remember if you went over it already. No more wondering if the floors really need a vacuuming or not, since you can see it right away!

Then there's the hair tool attachment. This little thing works better than anything I've used before at getting hairs off of furniture. But even more than that, it works exceptionally well at vacuuming the upholstery inside my vehicles, especially the dog hair that gets attached to everything inside my truck. I'm sure the sheer power of the suction is a big part of that too though.

With all these attachments though, you'll need somewhere to store them. The bracket to hang the vacuum on can only hold so many.

Next on the list is the battery, because how strong the motor is doesn't really matter if you can't power it. I'm happy to report that so far, after a week's use, this battery lasts longer than other cordless vacs I've had. I just have a small 1544 s.f. house, but I can easily vacuum every inch of floor surface on one single charge. My previous cordless vac, even when brand new just a year ago, required a second battery to get the whole house done. 

One of the reasons that the battery lasts longer is because of the automatic power adjustment based on the dirt level it senses. You'll mostly notice this on hard surfaces as it tends to be in 'eco' mode, but powers up fast when it detects a lot of hair/debris. Of course it allows you to choose your own mode if you want to keep it in eco or boost all the time.

The vac also has a small lcd screen that shows what mode you're in, the battery level, and the different sized particles of dirt/dust it's picked up. This last bit seemed a bit gimmicky to me as well, and while it's cool to see, it's not as useful as the laser head which shows you the dust itself.

Last thing I want to talk about is the ergonomics of this vacuum. Unfortunately, this is where the flaws show up. Weight wise it's not too heavy and lighter than my other stick vacuum so that's good. The handle though is the problem. After a bit of use, the weight of the motor being above my hand kept putting pressure on the knucklebone of my thumb, which after a while, started to get sore. It became much more noticeable after picking it back up later the same day. My wife also had an issue but it was with her trigger finger, but same type of cause. Even when you try to adjust your hand position, the weight of the motor being above just forces it down on your hand.

Speaking of the trigger, it is nice for the fact that you can easily release it and save some battery when you're not actively on the floor vacuuming. And it's very light so just maintaining a normal grip on the handle is enough to keep it pressed in. However, it would have been nice to have some sort of trigger 'lock' to keep it on. I actually had a use case this morning where I needed both hands to do something with the vacuum on, but couldn't because I had no way of actually keeping it on. I had to get my wife to help and hold the trigger in for me. It's a rare situation, but still one to be aware of.

Overall, this is by far the strongest cordless vac I've ever used that rivals the best corded ones. The few negatives are minor in comparison to all the positives and while this isn't a cheap vacuum, it lives up to the Dyson reputation and as the saying goes, you get what you pay for, and with this you get peace of mind that it's actually picking up all the dirt, dust, hair and debris from your floors and carpets.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5,"bestRating":"5"},"publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Best Buy"}}

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

div.h4: Dyson hits homeroom, laser guide, great suction

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
So unboxing this was fun. Every single piece was individually wrapped or in a box. Dyson is making sure this is well protected until it is ready for use. First thing you will want to do is charge the battery for about 4-5 hours. So locate the battery and charger quickly and plug them in, then continue your unboxing. I like that Dyson includes a way to wall mount the unit and a place to keep most of the attachments when not in use. You can set this up while you are waiting for the battery to fully charge
When the battery is ready, you simply re attach it to the unit and then you need to cycle through a few menu options before you can start. The color display is fantastic. There is a single button below the display, pressing it once will cycle through the options present to you. LONG press when you want to Select an option or confirm a choice. This display will show you the scientific proof of a deep clean and will separate the dust picked up into different categories: >10pm (pollen), >60pm (Skin Flakes), >180pm (Fine Sand), >500 pm (Sugar). This display also shows the run time countdown timer so you know how much battery you have left as well as which power mode you selected.
Once you have gone through the menu settings you are ready to use your vacuum. I have owned two Dyson cordless vacuums in the past and this is by far the best one ever. You get all the standard attachments but this time you get two cleaner heads. The first is the laser slim fluffy cleaner head. This is designed for hard floors and has a precisely angled laser that makes dust visible. I had no idea what to expect but this is my favorite feature by far. Being able to SEE where you have been and where you need to still vacuum is a game changer. I could not wait to try this attachment out first and I was quickly rewarded. The laser is perfectly bright to see in all light conditions. You will only see several inches in front of you as you go but that is all you need to see. Wow, I had no idea how dirty my floors were until I shined a light on them. Then I found myself constantly looking at the display to see what types of dust I was picking up. The second head is the more traditional High Torque cleaner head for deep cleaning of rugs and carpets.
My initial use of the vacuum I was able to use both the hard floor head and the carpet head. I was able to use it for about 45 min total the first time. The hard floor head will use the least amount of battery power even when using the laser. When you switch to carpet, it takes more power from the battery (which is to be expected) so it drains more quickly. Suction was equal to any of my full corded vacuums.
So now it is full and ready to be emptied. You will remove the attachments so you are left with only the main unit in your hand. Using both hands, one hand will hold the unit like you were vacuuming, and the other hand will then press down on the red lever on the outside of the canister. Be sure you are positioned over a trash can before you do this. This red lever will MOVE the entire canister down towards the trash can and away from your trigger hand. If you push slowly you will see it move and the unit becomes longer. When it reaches the end, it will pop open on the end and empty the contents into the trash receptacle. The first time I did this I was too quick and was not quite expecting the action. So it emptied quickly. The next time I was more intentional when pressing the red lever so I could see the canister moving and I stopped when it got to the end. Then I pressed harder when I was ready to empty it. To be honest, for me this is one area that could use an update in the next version. I REALLY like how the canister slides, in the older models I had, the canister was fixed so if something was still stuck in the top of the canister it was harder to clear. Now you can quite easily get all the debris out of the canister. But the area that could use some updates is the actual release at the end. It just snaps open. I would like a little more control over the actual opening of the canister. I also noticed that hair had gotten wrapped around the inside section of the canister which is to be expected, but as I slid the canister open to empty it the canister went past the hair and now I had to pull it off the canister manually. Not sure the fix for this but something you will likely notice.
I do wish the unit would come with 2 batteries so you could always have one fully charged ready to go. And I do wish there was a way to LOCK the power on so you did not have to squeeze the trigger the entire time using the unit.
Next I used the smaller attachments to clean the couches, cushions and inside our cars. They worked flawlessly, and in all my use so far I have yet to have any hair tangled on the rollers. These work as advertised. TANGLE FREE for sure. Well done Dyson engineers on this.
To recap: Highlights: - Laser attachment on the hard floor head - Menu display - Tangle Free - Process to empty the canister - Long battery life - Amazing suction - Wall Mount and a place for attachments
Wish List for Future Enhancements - A way to LOCK the power trigger - A second battery - A slower release when emptying the canister

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
I've been using the v7 for years now, and have liked it though the battery was a little short on that. I expected a little upgrade with the v15, but got a whole lot more. First, the battery is much better (even new the v7 was maybe 20 min, this is close to 60), second, the way you clean it out is improved (with the point and shot bin), and third, the intelligence works great as I have multiple floor types and it changes depending on the one I'm on. The performance is also great and it picks up much more compared to a few other vacuums and shop vacuums I've tried.
If you don't already own a Dyson, and are comparing vacuums, this is one I highly suggest as it works better than anything I've used. You also get a lot of different ends to be able to use this on so many things.

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

div.h4: More than just a party trick

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
The main reason I was interested in this is simply because of the Dyson name on it. I am happy to report that it absolutely lives up to its namesake. The Dyson V15 Detect is one of the best vacuums I have ever used, cordless or otherwise. The powerful motor sucks up super fine, silt-like dirt. This is made even better by it being cordless. You can head straight to the mess without having to worry where the nearest outlet is or sacrificing any performance whatsoever. The multiple power modes allow you to select how much cleaning power you need with just a simple button press. I found that Auto mode is great at balancing power consumption with cleaning power and is the mode I almost all the time. The Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head allows you to see even the smallest specs of dirt so that you never have to worry about missing a spot on your hard floors. I have included a picture of it in action. When you need to clean the carpeted areas of your home, switching heads is literally a snap. The feature I simultaneously love and hate the most is the particle counter on the LCD screen. I love it because it shows you, in real time, how much cleaner your place is becoming. Also, it makes cleaning seem like a game. Watching the numbers and graphs get larger makes you want to keep cleaning, even if for no reason other than seeing how high of a score you can get. I hate it because the high numbers show me how much dirt my other vacuums were leaving behind. During my initial use, I saw particle counts of nearly a billion (see picture). On top of that, I feel like it is shaming me for not cleaning my place as often as I evidently should.
As good as the V15 is, there are some things that I do not like about it. It takes a considerable amount of time to recharge. Going from 30% to a full charge took around 4 hours. Run time on a full charge leaves a bit to be desired as well. If left in Auto mode, you can get around an hour of continuous run time before you need to return it to its dock. If you switch it to boost mode, this time decreases to as little as 20 minutes. To make matters worse, utilizing the laser on the hard floor head shortens usage time even further. During my very unscientific test, vacuuming with the laser on seemed to use around 25% more battery power. With that being said, I believe that one charge will last long enough to clean most houses, provided that you don’t leave it in boost mode. Speaking of which, switching between modes is simple and straightforward but adjusting other settings is a bit more cumbersome. You have to press and hold the button to bring up the menu. Then once you adjust the setting to how you like it, you must press and hold the button for 3 seconds to confirm your choice. This isn’t the most intuitive method, but I suppose that most people will only have to do this once. Another issue is that the collection bin is not very large. I found myself emptying it every 5 minutes or so. Admittedly, this is a hard thing for me to complain about. Having a small collection bin keeps the unit portable and compact. Plus, the only reason it fills up so quickly is because it is doing such a fantastic job at cleaning. Personally, I’d rather empty it constantly than have it leave dirt behind like my other vacuums apparently were. But I did feel like it was worth mentioning.
At the end of the day, it is highly unlikely that you will be disappointed with the Dyson V15 Detect. It will show you dirt and dust you may have missed, clean it up, and tell you how much was there. Just leave it in Auto and let Dyson’s technology do the work for you. Oh, and return it to the dock when you’re finished.

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 4 out of 5 stars

div.h4: Dyson is doing again moving the high expectation

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
This is review of Dyson v15 Detect newly introduced with variety of technology elements. These elements are engineered cleaner head, powerful motor, intelligent mode, LCD screen with data references, advanced filtration, and wide option of accessories. But first, to give context of the further down details, it is result of comparing to the experience of using Dyson Cinetic Big Ball Canister Vacuum and V6 vacuum and its Slim version for about 5 years minimum.
Now, my experience in short time of usage and the first impression at glance: A) What I liked most was the quite low and smooth level of engine noise and independence from cord for deep cleaning of carpet and hard floor. B) What didn’t like were multiple factors at glance: 1) battery charging time, 2) can’t vacuum entire house with one full charge of battery, 3) need to switch the cleaner head between floor type 4) wand is not extendable.
Its most noticeable feature is the cleaner head for hard floor which has option to turn on/off to reveal microscopic dust with laser, secondly the high torque cleaner head for carpet floor type and both are included in the package. With this, vacuuming on the carpet, it has done well the job of grabbing the dust that are note visible or tangible from the surface. The vacuuming experience itself felt alike using a upright style vacuums as you push hardly toward the floor and naturally without cord that ease as one doesn’t have worry about tangling cord as move around. And using the cleaner head for carpet feels heavier than using cleaner head for hard floor as its size and wight is heavier and bigger. Then as vacuum around, can see the data references from the LCD pertinent to picked-up particles, run time count down and level of power selected which can be changed as work. But I was not quite paying attention to those information except for remaining level of battery that somehow was still guessing game for first few usage. And it worth to note that the battery indicator is more effective in a sense of delivering the message showing in percentage charged that is only available while charging status. If not it during the usage shows three icons with level of battery as select from Eco, Boost and Auto fro which I couldn’t tell how much left of battery.
Then vacuuming the carpet under bookshelf is bit hard due to the thickness of the neck in a style of ball on the connection of the cleaner head and wand.The using crevice and combination tool is straight forward and usual as is in rest of Dyson vacuums.
And using the hair doesn’t get tangled in the any of brush used. And the new addition of Dyson Hair Tool is sturdy and effective removing hair from any surface. Didn’t have to remove the hair from the brush roll. But this was the same experience with the two cleaner head. And this is quite helpful as at least with my existing vacuum after completion had to spend a moment to remove tangled hair. However, it become something to pay attention when cleaning or emptying the bin to de described separately.
A note on the cleaner head. Based on usage of canister and V6, which has its cleaner head version, the black brush or hair in it get wear out or of cut off after some usage. For this reason had to replace the brush roll several time. But for V15 Detect, it looks better glued or it is put together with a rubber like material. And its angle of placement is diagonal. But the material itself feels the same hence kind of have to use number of time to tell if it has been improved in that sense.
On the subject of how much of dust or dirt get removed from the carpet, with using the Eco/Medium mode, after having vacuumed with V15 the entire carpet area, immediately vacuumed with Cinetic Big Ball Canister Vacuum same area. The expectation was nothing would have picked up, but the result was it did still pick up dust.
The Laser slim Fluffy cleaner head this is totally new. It has the laser guide to turn on/off to see dust on the hard floor. The roll is made of a sponge like material that as it moves and does a sort of wiping action and suction the dust inward to the bin. It is quite imaginative such that the dust doesn’t stay on the roll. Then with the laser guidance, it help to see what is not visible with bear eyes and it was more effective on the wood hard floor type. However, in certain parts I had to pass twice to get it removed from the floor. On the same cleaner head, it has rear soleplate that has blue soft material, and this seems glued and same as the one used for Cinetic version. This come to mention because as use, somehow it comes off and mostly hard to place back or have to replace the part.
Using the rest of accessories, it help to reach areas that are alike corner and small spaces. But two observations, one is that if one is user of other Dyson models and have wide variety of accessories, those doesn’t fit as the size of the join is different. Secondly to use in the narrow spaces the bin size get on the way to reach deeper or using with wand one has to stand in quite odd positions and uncomfortable . And using to reach the overhead or high ceilling is not practical as is heavy to use with the wand.
Then during the usage after about 15 min, it feels fatigue between the fingers as press the trigger. During the usage, have to adjust way of grabbing differently.
The V15 also in its material describe the run time will calibrate as it is learning machine that continuously improve the performance with use. In this aspect I can’t tell the different from three time used between day of having started to use to this day of review. But if that is true my guess is the battery would last longer to complete vacuuming the same area, but for these would require follow up.
To finish, V15 Detect seems to do well for what is intended in the design, which is remove micro particles, deeper vacuum on carpet and these being supported with nicely put together elements of laser, lcd screen with data reference, and cleaner head with its own power. And it comes with reasonable number of accessories.
However, for the price point feels it comes bit short in a following aspects; - The pickup particle information doesn’t fee need during the vacuuming process as I can’t act on it or prevent any thing based on that information. - On the data reference again, it would be more useful to have them from an App to understand them and have suggestion or alike to take action. - It is meant to finish the job in one hour if fully charged. This feel like using mobile phone that put the mental mode to rush to finish what ever before the battery die. And this is a problem if one have area to cover and usually would finish in two hours span. - Charging the battery takes too long. For full charge takes about 4 hours and half. To charge about 15% took me about one hour and half. - Doesn’t come with second battery to ease above situation and most probably need to buy separately which is bit awkward considering premium level of the product that has all the details considered.
In conclusion, as for my need I can’t complete whole house cleaning, I wouldn’t recommend it, but it serve for specific category of need like small area or need for quick vacuum that would do the work right

Its most noticeable feature is the cleaner head for hard floor which has option to turn on/off to reveal microscopic dust with laser, secondly the high torque cleaner head for carpet floor type and both are included in the package. With this, vacuuming on the carpet, it has done well the job of grabbing the dust that are note visible or tangible from the surface. The vacuuming experience itself felt alike using a upright style vacuums as you push hardly toward the floor and naturally without cord that ease as one doesn’t have worry about tangling cord as move around. 
And using the cleaner head for carpet feels heavier than using cleaner head for hard floor as its size and wight is heavier and bigger. Then as vacuum around, can see the data references from the LCD pertinent to picked-up particles, run time count down and level of power selected which can be changed as work. But I was not quite paying attention to those information except for remaining level of battery that somehow was still guessing game for first few usage. And it worth to note that the battery indicator is more effective in a sense of delivering the message showing in percentage charged that is only available while charging status. If not it during the usage shows three icons with level of battery as select from Eco, Boost and Auto fro which I couldn’t tell how much left of battery.

Then vacuuming the carpet under bookshelf is bit hard due to the thickness of the neck in a style of ball on the connection of the cleaner head and wand.The using crevice and combination tool is straight forward and usual as is in rest of Dyson vacuums.

And using the hair doesn’t get tangled in the any of brush used. And the new addition of Dyson Hair Tool is sturdy and effective removing hair from any surface. Didn’t have to remove the hair from the brush roll. But this was the same experience with the two cleaner head. And this is quite helpful as at least with my existing vacuum after completion had to spend a moment to remove tangled hair. However, it become something to pay attention when cleaning or emptying the bin to de described separately.

A note on the cleaner head. Based on usage of canister and V6, which has its cleaner head version, the black brush or hair in it get wear out or of cut off after some usage. For this reason had to replace the brush roll several time. But for V15 Detect, it looks better glued or it is put together with a rubber like material. And its angle of placement is diagonal. But the material itself feels the same hence kind of have to use number of time to tell if it has been improved in that sense.

On the subject of how much of dust or dirt get removed from the carpet, with using the Eco/Medium mode, after having vacuumed with V15 the entire carpet area, immediately vacuumed with Cinetic Big Ball Canister Vacuum same area. The expectation was nothing would have picked up, but the result was it did still pick up dust. 

The Laser slim Fluffy cleaner head this is totally new. It has the laser guide to turn on/off to see dust on the hard floor. The roll is made of a sponge like material that as it moves and does a sort of wiping action and suction the dust inward to the bin. It is quite imaginative such that the dust doesn’t stay on the roll. Then with the laser guidance, it help to see what is not visible with bear eyes and it was more effective on the wood hard floor type. However, in certain parts I had to pass twice to get it removed from the floor. 
On the same cleaner head, it has rear soleplate that has blue soft material, and this seems glued and same as the one used for Cinetic version. This come to mention because as use, somehow it comes off and mostly hard to place back or have to replace the part.

Using the rest of accessories, it help to reach areas that are alike corner and small spaces. But two observations, one is that if one is user of other Dyson models and have wide variety of accessories, those doesn’t fit as the size of the join is different. Secondly to use in the narrow spaces the bin size get on the way to reach deeper or using with wand one has to stand in quite odd positions and uncomfortable . And using to reach the overhead or high ceilling is not practical as is heavy to use with the wand.

Then during the usage after about 15 min, it feels fatigue between the fingers as press the trigger. During the usage, have to adjust way of grabbing differently.

The V15 also in its material describe the run time will calibrate as it is learning machine that continuously improve the performance with use. In this aspect I can’t tell the different from three time used between day of having started to use to this day of review. But if that is true my guess is the battery would last longer to complete vacuuming the same area, but for these would require follow up.

To finish, V15 Detect seems to do well for what is intended in the design, which is remove micro particles, deeper vacuum on carpet and these being supported with nicely put together elements of laser, lcd screen with data reference, and cleaner head with its own power. And it comes with reasonable number of accessories. 

However, for the price point feels it comes bit short in a following aspects;
- The pickup particle information doesn’t fee need during the vacuuming process as I can’t act on it or prevent any thing based on that information.
- On the data reference again, it would be more useful to have them from an App to understand them and have suggestion or alike to take action.
- It is meant to finish the job in one hour if fully charged. This feel like using mobile phone that put the mental mode to rush to finish what ever before the battery die. And this is a problem if one have area to cover and usually would finish in two hours span.
- Charging the battery takes too long. For full charge takes about 4 hours and half. To charge about 15% took me about one hour and half. 
- Doesn’t come with second battery to ease above situation and most probably need to buy separately which is bit awkward considering premium level of the product that has all the details considered.

In conclusion, as for my need I can’t complete whole house cleaning, I wouldn’t recommend it, but it serve for specific category of need like small area or need for quick vacuum that would do the work right","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":4,"bestRating":"5"},"publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Best Buy"}}

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
I've owned a couple of previous Dyson cordless vacuums, including the V7 Fluffy and the V11 Torque Drive. After purchasing the V11 and using it for a couple of years, I was convinced that Dyson had reached the peak of cordless vacuum technology. Now, with the V15 Detect, Dyson has taken the excellent foundation of the V11 and added some killer new features. Once again, I'm left wondering -- How can vacuuming get any better than this? Dyson has one-upped themselves yet again.
=== UNBOXING AND OVERVIEW === - If you've owned any previous Dyson cordless model, you'll feel right at home here. The V15 is extremely easy to unbox and set up, though be prepared to sift through a lot of cardboard and protective packaging to find everything in the box. - This particular model features a glossy grey stainless steel-looking color on the wand. It looks great but is a fingerprint magnet. - The V15 Detect comes with two cleaner heads (the Laser Slim Fluffy and the High Torque) and five attachments (hair screw tool; soft dusting brush; crevice tool; combination tool; and stubborn dirt brush). - Dyson recommends charging the vacuum for at least 4.5 hours or until 100% before first use. - The biggest selling points of the new V15 are the angled laser on the Fluffy head to easily reveal dust as well as the new sensors that optimize suction based on floor type and the amount of dust detected. The included LCD screen actually shows you the total amount of debris and dust collected (measured in micrometers) as you vacuum. More on all of this below.
=== LASER SLIM FLUFFY HEAD PERFORMANCE === - For me, the new laser Fluffy head is the best past of the V15, by far. I live in an apartment that consists of 90% laminate flooring, and my floors have never felt so clean. Gone are the days of wondering if you've actually picked up all of the dust and crumbs on your hard floor. As you can see in the attached photo, there is a green laser on the right side of the Fluffy head that projects at a 90-degree angle. - The laser works great, though it is a bit dim on the left side of the head. Regardless, I have found dust and crumbs in places on my floor that I never thought were there. The laser reveals even the smallest amount of dust and hair so you can be sure you don't miss anything. - The laser does not work very well in a bright room. For the best performance, I have to turn off most of my lights and close my blinds. Not a huge deal to me as that is a small price to pay for a clean floor. - The laser can be turned off via a small switch on the head itself, though it's unclear what impact this has on battery life (probably little or none).
=== HIGH TORQUE CLEANER HEAD === - This cleaner head is mainly for use on rugs and carpet, though it can also be used on hard floors. Unlike previous versions of the torque drive cleaner head, this "High Torque" version has polycarbonate teeth which prevents hair from tangling around the bristles. - Once again, it works as advertised. I have vacuumed my bedroom carpet extensively with this cleaner head and have not noticed any hair wrapped around the bristles -- it all makes its way into the bin. - Like the Fluffy head, the High Torque head will adjust the vacuum's suction based on floor type and carpet thickness to maximize battery life and cleaning performance. On both cleaner heads, you can choose Eco, Auto, or Boost modes via a button below the LCD screen. Boost mode obviously provides the best performance but there is a big hit to battery life.
=== OTHER FEATURES AND THOUGHTS === - Another new feature of the V15 is the measurement of debris and particles collected. Results are shown on the LCD screen as you clean. The machine measures particles in sizes of 10, 60, 180, and 500 micrometers, which is roughly the equivalent of pollen, skin flakes, fine sand, and fleas, respectively. I live in a very dusty climate and it has been a revelation to see just how many fine particles have been sitting on my floor and floating throughout my apartment. - Like previous Dyson vacuums, the V15 is very easy to clean and maintain. The point-and-shoot design of the canister makes it very easy to empty debris directly into a trash can. The filter keeps dust out of the air and is easy to clean by just running it under a faucet. - Dyson claims that the V15 will provide "up to 60 minutes of run time," although this certainly varies based on the cleaner head used as well as the performance mode you have selected. I typically keep it on Auto and battery life has not been an issue. Luckily, the V15 comes standard with a click-in battery pack that is easily swappable. So if you have a larger home, it might be worth picking up a spare battery pack to always have one charged. - I was pleasantly surprised to see that the V15 fits perfects in my V11 Floor Dok (see photo). To get it to charge in the Dok, I had to add a bit of padding in the charging cradle underneath the plug/barrel to raise it up higher. The charging port on the V15 is a bit more recessed than that of the V11, so you have to make the barrel protrude a bit further up from the Dok.
=== OVERALL === The Dyson V15 Detect is a game-changer for those with large areas of hard floors. Forget the brooms, Swiffers, and clunky old vacuums – this will be your new favorite cleaning tool. The addition of the laser Fluffy head and the debris measurements are invaluable for someone like me who enjoys a clean home. Call me crazy, but the V15 makes me actually look forward to vacuuming! The versatility and expandability of this machine is also unmatched by any other brand. Highly recommended!

The versatility and expandability of this machine is also unmatched by any other brand. Highly recommended!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","ratingValue":5,"bestRating":"5"},"publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Best Buy"}}

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p: Rated 5 out of 5 stars

img.alt: Tech Insider Network Member

div.p:
Dyson is one of those brands that doesn't need any introduction, specially their vacuums. V15 is no different. This is the best vacuum that we have used so far. I admit, I was a bit skeptical that a smaller stick vacuum could do the job in an almost 2700 sq ft house. Our previous dyson vacuum (ball) is not cordless and is the beast. Since this V15 is cordless, I expected it to be less powerful than my old one but to my surprise, it's gave tough competition. We are just in love with it. The brains Dyson added to this vacuum, along with the bigger battery capacity, have immensely added to the vacuum time I get on a charge. We also own a cordless vacuum from a different brand and the battery life is just awful on that. We hardly get around 15 mins (max) on it. So my expectation from Dyson V15 wasn't high as far as the battery life is concerned but boy, have I been surprised. This thing packs a major punch, and as a clean freak I couldn’t ask for a better machine. It is quiet, sophisticated, and easy to maneuver from hardwoods to carpet and rugs.
Upon opening, you will find an abundance of accessories packed nicely inside the box. Our previous dyson also came with a lot of accessories, We haven't even used half of them. At this point, I'm not sure if accessories are interchangeable or not. I haven't tried that yet but I think they are. It also comes with wall mount if you wish to mount it on wall for storing and/or charging. This is another feature that I like about dyson products, they think of all possible ways to meet customer requirements. The vacuum came pre-charged but I still put it on charge as dyson recommends. It took about an hour to fully charge but usually it takes about 4.5 hours to charge if it's completely dead. The extra power of the V15 does add size and weight to the vacuum. The battery is a bit bigger, the motor is a bit bigger and the filter is bigger.
Aesthetically the the coolest thing is the LED display that shows what mode you are using the vacuum in. It has 3 different modes: 1) Eco, 2) Medium & 3) Boost. The modes work exactly how they are named with Eco mode being the slowest and Boost being the most powerful mode. The battery usage will depend upon what mode you use the vacuum in. You will get most battery life in Eco mode and less in Boost mode. The good thing is LCD screen displays how much battery is left in terms of minutes. Dyson claims it can give you up to 60 minutes but again it all depends upon the mode of usage. The vacuum can be transformed in to a handheld one should you need to use it for vacuuming your car or upholstery. It also calculates and categorizes picked-up particles.
It comes with a total of 7 cleaner heads. These are: 1) High torque cleaner head 2) Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head 3) Hair screw tool 4) Mini soft dusting brush 5) Crevice tool 6) Combination tool 7) Stubborn dirt brush
The Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head features a precisely-angled laser which reveals microscopic dust specifically on hard floor. Laser can be turned On/Off with the switch on the cleaner head. My wife owns the Dyson hair dryer and the V15 vacuum sounds exactly same as that. Honestly, I would never tell the difference if you run of these gadgets while I'm blindfold.
It’s pricey, yes. But I’m 100% convinced it’s well worth the hole in your wallet. If you’re on the fence, stop sitting there and get this vacuum. It exceeds all expectations, and I’m so excited to continue to clean with it.

vacuum ever!!! I didn’t know that my dog was shedding. When I used the device that has the laser light, it lit up all the hair that fell off my dog. I cringed when I saw my floor like that and started vacuuming away. I vacuumed the furniture, table, kitchen cabinet, chairs, walls, you name it, I vacuumed it. Even my fake plants and flowers. My house feels clean. It’s worth the money. And I’m saving money too, because, I ditched my broom. swiffer duster, swiffer cloth that you use on the floor. To top it off, I don’t have to hire a cleaning lady, because, I was thinking of getting one. This vacuum does the job so fast. It saves time in doing the cleaning. All you have to do is charge it fully and if it runs out off charge, you can do something else around the house while you charge it again. I highly recommend this vacuum. My only regret is, “why didn’t I get it sooner!!!” I didn’t like the price of this vacuum, so, I bought cheaper vacuums and other paraphernalia. In the end, I spend more money. Take my advice, buy this vacuum, you won’t regret it. currently own a Dyson Big Ball Cinetic vacuum, and I've been interested in a cordless Dyson for some time. The Dyson V15 Cordless Vacuum is extremely powerful, and has more than enough suction for both hard surfaces and carpet.\r\n\r\nIf you are looking for a primarily hard floor vacuum, I can't recommend this vacuum highly enough. I would give it a 10 out of 5 stars if I could for the hard surface innovative technology they put into this vacuum, which I'll go into further later. \r\n\r\nIf you are looking primarily for a carpet vacuum, I would suggest going with an upright vs this cordless model. The cordless model definitely cleans carpet well and has incredible suction, but the bin fills quickly and is awkwardly difficult to push on carpet. Don't get me wrong, it absolutely will get the job done, and for my house that is 75% hard floors and 25% carpet, it may end up being my preferred vacuum overall if I'm only vacuuming a single room at a time, but I found myself emptying the bin several times cleaning a single room, so a larger canister would be preferred.\r\n\r\nTHE LASER\r\nThe hard surface attachment, give the name \"Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head\" is an absolute game changer for hard surfaces. It's literally mind blowing, and the attached photos will showcase why. Areas where I wouldn't have thought to clean, such as behind a book case lit up when the green laser shined on the area, and I couldn't help but move the bookcase to clean up what is admittedly a disgusting amount of dust and hair that had accumulated.\r\n\r\nNot only is it practical to have dust and hair highlighted by a laser when cleaning the floors, it also gives a sense of accomplishment when the job is complete and the laser no longer shows signs of any nasty things remaining to be cleaned. I feel better about the clean because there is physical evidence that something is different now vs before I cleaned. To be honest, it has made me more interested in cleaning more frequently as well because I can really tell when it's making a difference or not. Surprisingly, the central walkway areas are actually pretty clean already. The sides of the walkways and the walls are where the dust and hair accumulate. It makes sense, but I never would have realized it without this laser attachment.\r\n\r\nI did find the laser works better in darker environments. I actually vacuumed my laundry room and bathroom without turning on a light, and it made it easier to see the dust that collected and was picked up. \r\n\r\nThe slim profile allowed me to clean underneath a cabinet we have in one of our bathrooms. Though I wouldn't go so far as to say it was \"easy\", I wouldn't have cleaned the space at all with my normal vacuum, so it definitely is a bonus of using the handheld.\r\n\r\nThe vacuum comes with a number of other attachments, one for cleaning pet hair, one smaller attachment for smaller spaces, and another brush I imagine might be used when vacuuming out a car. Overall though, I'm most likely going to keep the laser attachment on and likely use my upright vacuum for carpet.\r\n\r\nSome minor negatives: \r\nWeight: Although it's a handheld vacuum, using it for extended periods of time or lifting it to try and vacuum awkward spaces isn't as carefree and easy as you might see in a commercial. I imagine my wife cleaning her entire car with this might be fairly taxing. It's not a dealbreaker, but it's something to be mindful of depending on the job you're looking the vacuum to do.\r\n\r\nCanister size and design: The vacuum sports an \"easy to use\" release lever that pushes the junk out of the canister into the trash. Generally pushing this lever up and down several times will get rid of the dust and hair, but it's not a simple one push empty I imagined it would be. Additionally, the canister doesn't fill up evenly so even though the left half of the canister was mostly empty, the right side filled up and overflowed past the rubber stopper that separates the canister from the filter system. This creates a situation where when emptying the canister, I had to reach up inside and pull hair out of the rubber gasket, dirtying my hands and defeating the purpose of the quick release lever. The canister also filled up very quickly. I imagine that's partly due to our negligence in up keeping the room I had vacuumed (it had been a while), but having to empty the canister several times in a single room was not ideal. Lastly, in order to empty the canister, the hose has to be disconnected from the main canister, adding an additional step to an already less-than-perfect process.\r\n\r\nI will say that the canister expulsion does work better than what is in my Dyson upright. It's not a bad design, but it could use some refining, and the rubber gasket should do a better job of keeping collected dust and hair out of the filtration chamber.\r\n\r\nBattery: There is an on-screen display that provides an estimate of time remaining while using the vacuum that automatically adjusts based on usage. I found when switching from the hard flooring to carpet that the run time cut in half. On hard floor, It estimated ~40 minutes remaining shortly after a full charge. I switched to the carpet attachment when it was at ~36 minutes remaining, and the estimated time dropped in half to ~18 minutes. This was fortunately enough time for me to complete what I had set out to vacuum, but really necessitates a full charge between any prolonged use. The battery was \"good enough\" but I wouldn't say it excelled. I imagine to get the \"up to 1 hour\" of runtime, that may be perhaps with no moving attachment, such as when vacuuming a car.\r\n\r\nMIXED\r\nAdvanced whole-machine filtration: This is a bit of a mixed feature. Dyson claims the air expelled from the vacuum is cleaner than the air we normally breathe. I think that innovation is amazing, and I'm glad to know that the powerful gust of air shooting out of the vacuum isn't further spewing allergens into the air. That said, the placement of the \"blower\" that expels air made vacuuming my office space very awkward. It's positioned on the side of the vacuum, so vacuuming around my desk caused papers to fly off my desk onto the floor, which was double inconvenient because I had to stop vacuuming to pick them up before I could vacuum the spot they fell on. The Dyson is powerful, which means there is a ton of air expelled to create the awesome suction that it has. It was nearly comical when papers 6 feet away would get blown right off a desk, but after the 4th time stopping the vacuum to pickup papers, it became a bit frustrating.\r\n\r\nThe LCD screen: Displays a cumulation of the particles that it picked up so you can see whether there are more allergen particles vs skin flakes or dust mites. It's neat I guess, but I'm not sure that information is actually useful to me.\r\n\r\nAll that said, for hard floors, I absolutely love this vacuum and can't recommend it highly enough. I'll say it again -- LASERS. It really is a functional game changer for house cleanliness and not gimmicky at all. \r\n\r\nIf you have have primarily hard floors, buy this Dyson V15 Detect, and you will not be disappointed.","topicType":"review","title":"Must have for hard floors - Also LASERS!","submissionTime":"2021-03-23T19:17:37.000-05:00","writeCommentUrl":"\u002Fsite\u002Freviews\u002Fsubmission\u002F6451330\u002Freview\u002F256108000?campaignid=RNR_page_&return="},{"author":"vrs99","badges":[{"badgeCode":"IncentivizedReview","badgeDescription":"Reviewers in this invitation-only program are provided products for the purpose of writing honest, unbiased reviews. ea1e8ed29f31.jpg"}],"positiveFeedbackCount":18,"pros":["Attachments","Battery","Cleaning"],"rating":5,"recommended":true,"text":"The Dyson V15 Detect is my second Dyson cordless style vacuum, first one was a hit and the V15 hits it out of the park. In a word, it is awesome. As always Dyson vacuums are stylish while delivering on exceptional cleaning and ease of use.\r\n\r\nFirst impression, the vacuum’s Hyperdymium motor and cannister are noticeably larger than my earlier model while maintaining the same overall length, brilliant engineering and design. The power and performance are amazing in a cord free machine, believe that it hands down outperforms my corded vacuum. According to ASTM F558 (vacuum testing standard) testing of the Hyperdymium motor shows the V15 “delivers the most suction of any cordless vacuum.” \r\n \r\nThe V15 Detect is well balanced, comfortable, easy to handle, incredibly quiet, and checks all the ergonomic boxes.\r\n\r\nEasy setup: unpack and attach the wand and battery to the vacuum, select an head attachment and you are set. \r\n\r\nThe charging\u002Fdocking station requires only two screws to mount to a wall for storage, thoughtfully Dyson kept the mounting screws pattern the same as our previous model. Simply installed the new docking station with the same screws into the same holes, appreciate the attention to detail.\r\n\r\nLCD Screen:\r\n1. Displays selectable Eco, Auto, or Boost power levels - we use Auto as the machine will adjust power based on amount of debris and battery runtime \r\n2. Battery charge runtime left in minutes and seconds\r\n3. Maintenance notifications\r\n4. Displays “scientific proof of a deep clean.” \r\nThe particulate displays shows Allergens, Microscopic Dust, Dust Mites and Sugar readouts that were vacuumed - 36,475,810 Allergens were picked-up a one minute on one test I ran! \r\n \r\n\r\n\r\nRuntime:\r\n1. Medium mode - 45 minutes with Power Head attachment\r\n2. Eco mode – 90 minutes\r\n3. Full charge – four hours\r\n \r\nSeven Accessories +\r\n1. Laser Slim Fluffy cleaner head - Laser Detect for Hardwood Floors Illuminates hidden dust on hard floors – cool feature\r\n2. High Torque Drive cleaner head - Deep cleans rugs and carpets and designed to prevent hairs being tangled in the brush\r\n3. Dyson Hair Tool – If you have an indoor pet this is an invaluable tool for removing pet hair from furniture and hard to get at spaces\r\n4. Crevice Tool\r\n5. Stubborn dirt brush\r\n6. Soft dusting brush – great for dusting the complete house – Blinds have never been so clean\r\n7. Combination tool\r\n8. Wand Storage Clip – can attach two of the smaller head attachments to the wand – handy\r\n\r\nLikes:\r\n1. Converts to hand held\r\n2. Filter traps 99.9 percent of allergen and dust particles – “Expels cleaner air than the air you breath”\r\n3. Trigger locks when battery needs a charge\r\n4. Bin is easy to clean, we eject the debris directly into our trash bags\r\n\r\nWe have many things in our life that needs cleaning and the Dyson V15 Detect simply answers the call, carpet, hard floor, rugs, blinds, air filters, fans, vehicles.... love to use it to clean the dust on desks, tables, pictures, crafts, bookshelves..... and makes quick work of it in their latest stroke of genius. \r\n\r\nYou may gather I like the machine, true but the proof is in the pudding, my wife loves the V15 and she is a tougher customer than I.","topicType":"review","title":"Dyson Delivers in their you DON'T want to know how dirty your floors are, don't get this. \r\nIn a word . . . AMAZING!\r\nI would give it 6 or 7 stars out of 5 if I could.\r\n\r\nTo set the scene: Our house was built in the 30s and has hardwood floors throughout. We have 2 dogs (a Rottie and a Yorkie) and 2 cats (1 long-haired, 1 short) who allow us to live with them. They are constantly in and out. We have hardwood floors throughout the house with a couple area rugs. \r\n\r\nPROS\r\n\r\n~ Amazing suction\r\n~ Laser\r\n~ Cordless\r\n~ Lightweight\r\n~ Comes with tons of heads\r\n~ Pivot on heads for angles\r\n~ Changing attachments very simple\r\n~Dumping cannister is easy and not messy\r\n~ Trigger activation like on a weedeater\r\n\r\n\r\n\r\nCONS\r\n\r\n~ Possibly battery Life (I will put this under MEH, too because I don't know for sure, but I'll explain)\r\n\r\n\r\nMEH (Could go either way)\r\n\r\n~Possibly battery life\r\n\r\n\r\nOVERALL\r\n\r\nAfter receiving this, I charged it per the instructions and then vacuumed a small section of carpet my wife vacuumed the night before with our old (now thrown away) vacuum cleaner. I only vacuumed about 10 square feet and we were both amazed and disgusted by the amount of stuff this vacuum picked up. I think it must have reached all the dirt that filters through carpets and stays there until you sell the house. LOL. The cannister was almost full after 10-15 Sq Ft. \r\n\r\nThe head for hardwood floors has a laser (shown in a photo). It will show every imperfection in your floor and speck of dust. It's awesome. \r\nYesterday, we vacuumed the entire house, including the sofa, drapes, etc. It had to be recharged a couple times. But the battery learns and extends time. It picks up or reduces speed based on the amount of grit\u002Fdirt. So, honestly, I expect it will actually last longer as the amount of ambient dust and grit is removed from my house.\r\n\r\nAlso pictured is what I gathered this morning just going over half the living room. That much additional dirt and hair fell in less than 24 hours. \r\n\r\nThe heads are on a ball\u002Fsocket kind of system like a shoulder where they have incredible flexibility and maneuverability.\r\n\r\nIt actually isn't that loud. It has a high pitch, but I think it's a little quieter than the full-sized vacuum we just tossed out. \r\n\r\nIf you're looking for a compact vacuum for mostly hard floors and some rugs\u002Fcarpets, I would highly recommend this one. It really is amazing. I vacuumed today just because it seemed fun to spot all the extra stuff. LOL. I couldn't be happier with this vacuum ... unless it learned how to fix me coffee in the morning. \r\n\r\nI hope this helps you. I generally don't gush like this over things I review, but it really is a great piece of machinery. If it is in your price range or even slightly above, do yourself, your family and your floors a favor and pick it up.","topicType":"review","title":"Absolutely AMAZING!!!","submissionTime":"2021-03-23T20:45:25.000-05:00","writeCommentUrl":"\u002Fsite\u002Freviews\u002Fsubmission\u002F6451330\u002Freview\u002F256114693?campaignid=RNR_page_&return="},{"author":"phoenixfta","badges":[{"badgeCode":"IncentivizedReview","badgeDescription":"Reviewers in this invitation-only program are provided products for the purpose of writing honest, unbiased reviews.
